software.leonov.system.monitor

Class BackgroundSystemMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.system.monitor.BackgroundSystemMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, SystemMonitor

    public final class BackgroundSystemMonitor
extends Object
    A thread-safe SystemMonitor implementation that asynchronously updates usage metrics using a dedicated background daemon thread.

    The monitor can be instantiated using a default or a custom update interval. The background thread must be explicitly started with the start() method. To shut down the monitor call stop() or close().

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Stops this monitor's background thread and waits for it to finish running.
      CpuUsage getCpuUsage()
      Returns the Central Processing Unit (CPU) usage metrics.
      MemoryUsage getMemoryUsage()
      Returns the physical memory (RAM) usage metrics.
      BackgroundSystemMonitor onClose(BiConsumer<CpuUsage,MemoryUsage> closeListener)
      Registers a listener which will be invoked when this monitor closes.
      BackgroundSystemMonitor onUpdate(BiConsumer<CpuUsage,MemoryUsage> updateListener)
      Registers a listener which will be invoked each time the CPU and memory usage metrics are updated.
      BackgroundSystemMonitor start()
      Starts this monitor's background thread.
      void stop()
      Stops this monitor's background thread and waits for it to finish running.
      static BackgroundSystemMonitor updateEvery(Duration updateInterval)
      Creates a new BackgroundSystemMonitor configured with the specified update interval.
      static BackgroundSystemMonitor withDefaultUpdateInterval()
      Creates a new BackgroundSystemMonitor configured with the default update interval of 1 second.

      • updateEvery

        public static BackgroundSystemMonitor updateEvery(Duration updateInterval)
        Creates a new BackgroundSystemMonitor configured with the specified update interval.

        The monitor's background thread will update all usage metrics after every updateInterval.

        Parameters:
        updateInterval - the time interval between consecutive metric updates
        Returns:
        a new BackgroundSystemMonitor configured with the specified update interval
